title: Freshwater withdrawals as a share of internal resources
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/freshwater-withdrawals-as-a-share-of-internal-resources?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Freshwater withdrawals refer to total water withdrawals from agriculture, industry and municipal/domestic uses. Withdrawals can exceed 100% of total renewable resources where extraction from non-renewable aquifers or desalination plants is considerable.

title: Freshwater withdrawals of foods per 1000 kilocalories
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/freshwater-withdrawals-per-1000kcal?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Freshwater withdrawals are measured in liters per 1000 kilocalories for a range of food products.

title: Freshwater withdrawals per 100 grams of protein
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/water-per-protein-poore?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Freshwater withdrawals are measured in liters per 100 grams of protein.

title: Freshwater withdrawals per kilogram of food product
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/water-withdrawals-per-kg-poore?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Freshwater withdrawals are measured in liters per kilogram of food product.

title: Global freshwater use over the long-run
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/global-freshwater-use-over-the-long-run?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Global freshwater withdrawals for agriculture, industry and domestic uses since 1900, measured in cubic metres (m³) per year.

title: Implementation of integrated water resource management
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/implementation-of-integrated-water-resource-management?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Integrated water resource management (IWRM) is a process which promotes the coordinated development and management of water, land and related resources in order to maximise economic and social welfare in an equitable manner without compromising the sustainability of vital ecosystems.

title: Industrial water as a share of total water withdrawals
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/industrial-water-as-a-share-of-total-water-withdrawals?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Industrial water withdrawals as a percentage of total water withdrawals (which is the sum of water used for agriculture, industry, and municipal purposes).

title: Industrial water withdrawal
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/industrial-water-withdrawal?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: This measures the annual quantity of self-supplied water withdrawn for industrial uses, in cubic metres (m³) per year. It includes water for the cooling of thermoelectric and nuclear power plants, but it does not include hydropower. Water withdrawn by industries that are connected to the public supply network is generally included in municipal water withdrawal.

title: Internal renewable freshwater resources by region
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/internal-renewable-freshwater-resources-by-region?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Renewable internal freshwater resources refers to the quantity of internal freshwater from inflowing river basins and recharging groundwater aquifers.

title: Municipal water as a share of total water withdrawals
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/municipal-water-as-a-share-of-total-water-withdrawals?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Municipal (domestic) water withdrawals as a percentage of total water withdrawals (which is the sum of water used for agriculture, industry, and municipal purposes).

title: Municipal water withdrawal
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/municipal-water-withdrawal?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Total water withdrawal for municipal (domestic) purposes, measured in cubic metres (m³) per year. Municipal water is the annual quantity of water withdrawn primarily for the direct use by the population.

title: Progress towards the implementation of UNCLOS
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/implementation-of-unclos?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Progress in implementing the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea through legal, policy and institutional frameworks. Higher values indicate greater progress.

title: Progress towards the ratification and accession of UNCLOS
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/ratification-and-accession-to-unclos?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Countries progress in ratifying and acceding United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS) and its two implementing agreements through legal, policy and institutional frameworks. Higher values indicate greater progress.

title: Renewable freshwater resources per capita
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/renewable-water-resources-per-capita?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Renewable internal freshwater resources flows refer to internal renewable resources (internal river flows and groundwater from rainfall) in the country.

title: Renewable freshwater resources per person
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/per-capita-renewable-freshwater-resources?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Renewable internal freshwater resources refers to the quantity of internal freshwater from inflowing river basins and recharging groundwater aquifers. This is measured in cubic meters per person per year.

title: Scarcity-weighted water use of foods per 1000 kilocalories
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/scarcity-water-use-kcals?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Scarcity-weighted water use represents freshwater use weighted by local water scarcity. This is measured in liters per 1000 kilocalories.

title: Scarcity-weighted water use per 100 grams of protein
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/scarcity-water-protein-poore?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Average scarcity-weighted water use represents freshwater use weighted by local water scarcity. This is measured in liters per 100 grams of protein.

title: Scarcity-weighted water use per kilogram of food product
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/scarcity-water-per-kg-poore?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Scarcity-weighted water use represents freshwater use weighted by local water scarcity. This is measured in liters per kilogram of food product.

title: Share of agricultural land which is irrigated
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/agricultural-land-irrigation?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: The percentage of total agricultural land area which is irrigated (i.e. purposely provided with water), including land irrigated by controlled flooding. Agricultural land is the combination of crop (arable) and grazing land.

title: Share of countries with procedures for community participation in water and sanitation management
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/share-of-countries-with-procedures-for-community-participation-in-water-sanitation-management?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: The share of countries in a given region with clearly defined procedures in law or policy for participation by service users/communities in planning programmes in water resources planning and management.

title: Share of domestic wastewater that is safely treated
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/wastewater-safely-treated?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: The proportion of wastewater from households and the service industry that is safely treated at the source or through centralized wastewater treatment plants before being discharged into the environment.

title: Share of industrial wastewater flows that are treated
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/share-of-industrial-wastewater-which-is-treated?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Industrial wastewater is includes wastewater generated from mining, manufacturing, construction and the production and distribution of electricity.

title: Share of land covered by lakes and rivers
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/share-of-land-covered-by-lakes-and-rivers?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: The percentage of total land area that is made up of lakes and rivers all year round.

title: Share of transboundary water basins with arrangement for water cooperation
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/water-basins-cooperation-plan?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: The share of transboundary basins area within a region or country with an operational arrangement for water cooperation

title: Share of water bodies with good ambient water quality
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/water-bodies-good-water-quality?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Water quality is assessed by means of core physical and chemical parameters that reflect natural water quality. A water body is classified as "good" quality if at least 80% of monitoring values meet target quality levels.

title: Status of the development and implementation of integrated national water resource management plans
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/status-of-the-development-and-implementation-of-integrated-national-water-resource-management-plans?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Share of countries across the various stages of development and implementation of integrated national water resource management plans (IWRM). IWRM is defined as "a process which promotes the coordinated development and management of water, land and related resources in order to maximise economic and social welfare in an equitable manner without compromising the sustainability of vital ecosystems."

title: Water productivity, GDP per cubic meter of freshwater withdrawal
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/water-productivity?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Water productivity is calculated as total gross domestic product (GDP), measured in constant 2015 US$ divided by annual total water withdrawal.

title: Water withdrawals per capita
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/water-withdrawals-per-capita?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Total water withdrawals from agricultural, industrial and municipal purposes per capita, measured in cubic meters (m³) per year.

title: Annual CO2 emissions from wildfires
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/annual-carbon-dioxide-emissions?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Carbon dioxide released by wildfires in tonnes. The 2024 data is incomplete and was last updated 21 June 2024.

title: Annual PM2.5 emissions from wildfires
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/annual-pm25-emissions-from-wildfires?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: PM2.5 emissions represent the quantity of fine particulate matter (diameter less than 2.5 micrometers) released by wildfires, in tonnes. The 2024 data is incomplete and was last updated 21 June 2024.

title: Annual area burnt by wildfires
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/annual-area-burnt-by-wildfires?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Area burnt by wildfires in hectares. The 2024 data is incomplete and was last updated 21 June 2024.

title: Annual area burnt by wildfires by region
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/annual-area-burnt-by-wildfires-gwis?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Total area of all land types burnt by wildfires in hectares.

title: Annual area burnt per wildfire vs. number of fires
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/annual-area-burnt-per-wildfire-vs-number-of-fires?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>

title: Annual number of wildfires
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/annual-number-of-fires?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Data source: Global Wildfire Information System (2024)

title: Area burned by wildfires by land cover type
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/area-burned-wildfires-by-type?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>

title: Average area burnt per wildfire
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/annual-area-burnt-per-wildfire?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: The average area burnt per wildfire, in hectares. The 2024 data is incomplete and was last updated 21 June 2024.

embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/cumulative-co-emissions-released-by-wildfires-by-week?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>

title: Cumulative area burnt by wildfires by week
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/cumulative-area-burnt-by-wildfires-by-week?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Cumulative area burnt by wildfires in hectares.

embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/weekly-cumulative-share-of-the-area-burnt-by-wildfires-each-year?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Percentage of the land area burnt by wildfires.

title: Share of the total land area burnt by wildfires each year
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/share-of-the-total-land-area-burnt-by-wildfires-each-year?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>

subtitle: Area burnt by wildfires in hectares. The 2024 data is incomplete and was last updated 21 June 2024.

title: Wildfire area burned by land cover type
embedding: <iframe src="https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/annual-burned-area-by-landcover?tab=map" loading="lazy" style="width: 100%; height: 600px; border: 0px none;" allow="web-share; clipboard-write"></iframe>
subtitle: Total area of forests, savannas, shrublands/grasslands, croplands, and other land that have been burned as a result of wildfires each year.
